thread.title: Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm he is staying as Arsenal manager despite admitting he has made a decision on his future
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm he is staying as Arsenal manager despite admitting he has made a decision on his future

author: dwright
title: Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm he is staying as Arsenal manager despite admitting he has made a decision on his future
text:
EFL tight lipped Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm he is staying as Arsenal manager despite admitting he has made a decision on his future 
Gunners boss still leaving supporters in suspense and says there are minor things to resolve By Duncan Wright 30th March 2017, 9:32 am Updated: 30th March 2017, 1:49 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENE WENGER has refused to reveal whether he is staying on as Arsenal manager – despite admitting he made his decision a long time ago. 
Wenger’s position as boss at the Emirates has come under scrutiny amid growing unrest among supporters who are calling for him to leave. Arsenal 5 Arsene Wenger is still refusing to reveal whether he wants to stay at Arsenal 
There is now a clear split between fans who are still behind Wenger and those who want him out, but the Frenchman has again snubbed the chance to put the supporters out of their misery. Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm about his decision to stay as manager at Arsenal 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
That is despite the understanding that the 67-year-old has decided he wants to stay on for another two years in charge. 
Asked if he had an announcement to make, Wenger said: "Not today. I am very clear in my mind. Do I stay two months or two years, my commitment will be the same. PA:Press Association There is growing unrest among the supporters but Wenger is still not telling them what his future is PA:Press Association 5 Arsene Wenger has been criticised by some sections of the Arsenal supporters 
"I have always been very clear in my mind. It is a subject that is not sorted completely out. I have nothing more to add to that." 
Wenger was challenged over whether the lack of clarity over his future is causing unrest among the club's supporters. Most read in football YOU WHAT? Alexis Sanchez casts doubts over Arsenal future after saying he wants to stay in London and play for winning team Yes way Jose Jose Mourinho is eyeing up a potential move for Atletico Madrid centre-back Jose Gimenez 'He is absurd' Jose Mourinho compares Manchester United's attempts to buy Neymar as like trying to crack open a vault Handy Andy Gladbach confirm Andreas Christensen WILL return to Chelsea after ace impressed Antonio Conte CUT AND DRIES Manchester United to offer £30m Dries Mertens £4.3m salary in bid to poach him from Napoli 
He added: "I believe the priority on life is to focus on what is important and not to look at excuses. 
"Results are not going the way we want but the priority for us is what happens on the pitch, not to find excuses where I think there are none." 
Arsenal face Manchester City on Sunday knowing a defeat could leave them a massive nine points adrift of the top four. 
And Wenger goes into one of the biggest matches of his career at Arsenal without first-choice goalkeeper Petr Cech, who is missing with a calf strain. 
Cech is likely to miss the City match and the game against West Ham next Wednesday, forcing the Gunners to use David Ospina in goal instead. Most read in football YOU WHAT? But there was better news over the fitness of Alexis Sanchez, who suffered an injury playing for Chile, and Mesut Ozil who has come through international duty with Germany unscathed. 
Wenger added: "We got a message from Alexis it was a kick, and we didn't know whether it had gone on to his tendon. Getty Images Arsene Wenger says he has no issues with Alexis Sanchez saying he wants to play for a club with a winning mentality 
"But the swelling went down and he can play. 
"Ozil is in contention to start again. He played 20 minutes with Germany against Azerbaijan. He came back focused." 
Wenger also leapt to the defence of striker Alexis Sanchez after his admission while on international duty he wants to be playing for a club with a winning mentality . 
Sanchez is unsettled at Arsenal and could be on the way out this summer, with Chelsea keen on taking him to Stamford Bridge. 
But Wenger said: “I interpret what he said in a positive way. 
“There is only one team in London so he is happy. 
"I think personally he is happy here. It is true we have not extended his contract yet. 
"The interpretation is not always exactly what they want to say. I don’t see anything negative." Getty Images Alexis Sanchez is unsettled at Arsenal and has been linked with a move to Chelsea Arsene Wenger and Alexis Sanchez - Is the Arsenal love story over? Arsenal fans march in protest before match of manager Arsene Wenger
